06111-d-07-09-06-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Train outside yard limits, in block signal or interlocking territory, excessive speed  [Desc.Changed
06111-d-07-09-06-URR.Accident Cause: Train outside yard limits, in block signal or interlocking territory, excessive speed  [Desc.Changed
06111-d-07-09-06-URR.Narrative: CREW USING LOCOMOTIVE CONSIST OF 5-1500 MP LOCOMOTIVES WAS HAULING 97 CAR LOADS OF COKE AND 1 CABOOSE NORTH ON THE NORTHBOUND MAIN TRACK.  TRAIN WAS IN THE "J" TOWER INTERLOCKING (DUQUESNE) WHEN THE 56TH CAR (EJE 20022) FROM LOCOMOTIVES DERAILED APPROXIMATELY 15 FEET NORTH OF THE MAIN TRACK #183 POWER SWITCH.  TRAIN CONTINUED NORTH APPROXIMATELY 15 CAR LENGTHS BEFORE STOPPING (EMERGENCY STOP).  THE 53RD, 54TH, AND 55TH CARS AND THE 58TH THROUGH 65TH CARS DERAILED BEFORE MOVEMENT STOPPED.  TRACKSURFACE AND INSUFFICIENT BALLAST AT #183 SWITCH ALONG WITH WORN RAIL AT POINT OF DERAILMENT CONTRIBUTED TO HARMONIC ROCK AND ROLL AND WHEEL LIFT.  CARS WERE HI-CUBE CARS AND RESTRICTED BY SPECIAL INSTRUCTION TO 10 MPH. SPEED WAS RECORDED AT 15 MPH AT TIME OF DERAILMENT.  MAIN TRACK WAS JOINTED RAIL.EXTENSIVE DAMAGE TO CSXT 296050 AND SEVERAL MAIN TRACK POWER SWITCHES IN INTERLOCKING.

06112-d-07-17-06-URR.Primary Accident Cause: Snow, ice, mud, gravel, coal, sand, etc. on track
06112-d-07-17-06-URR.Accident Cause: Snow, ice, mud, gravel, coal, sand, etc. on track
06112-d-07-17-06-URR.Narrative: THE DUQUESNE COAL DOCK LOADING CREW WAS HANDLING 87 LOADS AND 44 EMPTIES HOPPERS.  THE CREW WAS PULLING THE CARS NORTH UNDER THE LOAD-OUT BIN, THESE CARS WERE BEING LOADED WITH COAL.  THE BIN SHUTE WAS SLIGHTLY TWISTED CAUSING COAL TO SPILL ONTO THE TRACK AS EACH CAR WAS PASSED UNDER THE BIN.  THISBUILD UP OF COAL ON TRACK CAUSED WHEELS L-4 AND R-4 ON NS 29901 THE 74TH CAR FROM ENGINE TO CLIMBEDOFF RAIL AND DERAIL.  DERAILED CAR WAS NOT DISCOVERED AND CAR WAS PULLED NORTH.  WHEN DERAILED CAR CAME INTO CONTACT WITH FACING SWITCH POINT OF #3 BELOW SWITCH WHEEL CLIMBED OVER POINT DERAILING ALLWHEELS OF CAR.  MOVEMENT CONTINUED APPROXIMATELY FIVE CAR LENGTHS DERAILING 3 ADDITIONAL CARS ON LADDER TRACK.

7200602-d-07-26-06-CZRY.Primary Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
7200602-d-07-26-06-CZRY.Accident Cause: Buffing or slack action excessive, train handling
7200602-d-07-26-06-CZRY.Narrative:
TRAIN LCZO1J25 WAS PROCEEDING FROM COYOTE WELLS TO JACUMBA WITHOUT INCIDENT UNTIL APPROXIMATELY 0255ON 7/26/06.  INVESTIGATION SHOWS THAT ONE TRUCK CAME OFF OF THE TRACK ON THE LAST LOADED HOPPER JUST AHEAD OF THE CABOOSE.  THIS HAPPEN AT MP104.1.  THE TRAIN WAS DOING 11 MPH \AND THE PROBLEM OCCURRED WITH CAR 22 OUT OF  23 ON A 1.4 DEGREE UPHILL GRADE.  AFTER ONE TRUCK DERAILED,  THE ENGINEER CONTINUED WEST CAUSING MINOR DAMAGE TO TRACK FOR ANOTHER 400 DEGREE WHERE HE STOPPED AND APPARENTLY BACKED UP FOR 80 DEGREE.  THE ENGINEER THEN 
CONTINUED WEST NOW DERAILING THE CABOOSE CAUSING MORE SEVERE DAMAGE UNTIL HE TRAVELED ACROSS THE WEST MOST 7 SISTER TRESTLE AT MP103.97.  WHEN THE TRAIN PASSED OVER THE TRESTLE, THE LAST  2 CARS IN THE TRAIN THAT HAD DERAILED DAMAGED MOST OF THE TIES AND HALF OF THE WALKWAYS.  THE CABOOSE AND 22ND CAR, WHEN LEAVING THE WEST END OF THE TRESTLE, DUG INTO THE GROUNG AND LODGED THEMSELVE BETWEEN THE TRACK AND MOUNTAIN AT THE WEST END OF THE TRESTLE WHERE ITMEETS LEVEL GROUND AND CURVES TO THE LEFT.  THE STOPPING OF THE TRAIN CAUSED CARS 19, 20, AND 21 TOPARTIALLY DERAIL DUE TO  STRING LINING SINCE THE TRAIN WAS STILL ON A CURVE. THE LOCOMOTIVE PRINTOUT AND PHYSICAL MARKS ON THE TRACK SHOW THAT THE ENGINEER AND CONDUCTOR FAILED TO ANALYZE THE SITUATION FROM BOTH OPERATION AND SAFETY ASPECTS BY NOT STOPPING TO INSPECT  SITUATION.  THE LOCOMOTIVE PRINTOUT SHOWS THAT THE TRAIN HANDLING, SPECIFICALLY THE USE OF THE THROTTLE JUST PRIOR TO THE FIRST G

060706-d-07-06-06-KBSR.Primary Accident Cause: Switch rod worn, bent, broken, or disconnected
060706-d-07-06-06-KBSR.Accident Cause: Switch rod worn, bent, broken, or disconnected
060706-d-07-06-06-KBSR.Narrative: JULY 6, 2006 AT 830 AM UNITES 704 & 701 WERE TO BEGIN SWITCHING AROUND 80 EMPTIES.  COUPLED UP TO ASTRING OF 80 CARS.  CONDUCTOR GAVE THE GO AHEAD.  ENGINEER PROCEEDED TO THE SOUTH AND UP THE SIDE OFTHE HILL.  AT THE TOP OF HILL CONDUCTOR GOT OFF AT THE SOUTH SWITCH AND I KEPT THE TRAIN MOVING AT7 MPH.  WHEN WE WERE CLOSE TO HALFWAY THROUGH THE BOTTOM HILL SWITCH THE TRAIN WENT INTO EMERGENCY STOP.  THE CONDUCTOR ASK IF A REDUCTION HAD BEEN APPLIED, IT HAD NOT.  WE SECURED THE TRAIN AND PROCEEDED TO THE NORTH TO INSPECT THE TRAIN.  WHEN WE REACHED THE BOTTOM OF THE HILL WE SAW THAT 4 CARS HAD DERAILED IN THE SWITCH.  ONE OF THE DERAILED CARS HAD TILTED TO THE EAST AND STRUCK UNIT 705, WHICH HAD BEEN TIED DOWN AT THE CLEARANCE POINT FOR LATER USE.  WE NOTIFIED THE OFFICE.

580197-d-07-10-06-TCT.Narrative: 16 LOADED CARS 43 RESIDUE - ONE LOADED CAR WAS NOT HAZMAT - ALL OTHERS WERE PLACARDED.  AT APPROXIMATELY 9:15 PM THE 2ND 3PM JOB WAS ATTEMPTING TO SHOVE A TOTAL OF 72 CARS FROM THE TCT 600 YARD INTO THE UP'S OLD SP TRACK.  THE UTILITY MAN ASSIGNED TO THE ENGINE CREW WAS RIDING THE END OF THE CUT WHILE THE MOVE PASSED OVER THE CURVED TRANSFER TRACK.  YARDMASTER HAD LINED THE TRANSFER/SP TURNOUT ANDWAS WAITING FOR THE ENGINE CREW AT THIS POINT.  YARDMASTER INSTRUCTED ENGINE CREW THAT HE HAD CHECKED THE TRACK AHEAD AND THERE WAS NO NEED FOR THE ENGINE CREW TO RIDE THE CUT.  YARDMASTER FAILED TOREALIZE HIS VIEW WAS OBSTRUCTED BY DARKNESS AND SHADOW AND HE COULD NOT SEE THAT A CUT OF CARS HAD BEEN LEFT IN THE TRACK ABOUT 40 CAR LENGTHS AWAY BY THE UP.  UPON YARD MASTER INSTRUCTION THE ENGINEER PROCEEDED TO SHOVE THE TRAIN INTO THE UP TRACK.  ABOUT 40 CAR LENGTHS INTO THE TRACK THE LEADING END OF THE TRAIN UNEXPECTEDLY COUPED TO THE CUT OF ABOUT 25 CARS SETTING ON THE TRACK WITH AIR BRAKESSET.  THE RESULTING SUDDEN STOP COMBINED WITH THE CONTINUED FORCE OF THE LOCOMOTIVE AND TRAIN, EXERTED A "BUNCHING" FORCE ON THE TRAIN THAT "PINCHED OUT" THE MIDDLE OF THE CUT WHICH WAS STILL IN THECURVE.  THE LATERAL FORCE ROLLED THE OUTSIDE RAIL OF THE CURVE OVER AND THE CARS MOVED ABOUT 30 FEETOFF CENTER BEFORE COMING TO REST.  ALL CARS REMAINED COUPLED AND UPRIGHT BUT BOTH CARS AT THE "APEX" OF THE PINCH LOST TRUCKS COMING TO REST AT ABOUT A 90 DEGREE ANGLE.  THE LEADING END OF ONE CAR ST

526471-d-07-01-06-IC.Narrative: WHILE SWITCHING IN THE YARD, JOB M39731-28 WAS INSTRUCTED TO PULL TRACK MC14 AND SET IT OVER TO TRACK MC12 IN THE YARD.  AS THE CREW WAS SHOVING 48 CARS INTO TRACK MC12 THEY STRUCK 25 CARS THAT WERE ALREADY IN THE TRACK WHICH THEN PROCEEDED TO ROLL OUT THE NORTH END AND FOUL THE LEAD.  AT THE SAME TIME , YARD JOB R91271-30 HAD JUST LET A CUT OF 2 CARS, SSW 80780 AND CSXT 126178, GO DOWN THE LEAD HEADING FOR TRACK MC09.  THESE CARS WERE HIT BY THE CUT OF CARS SHOVED OUT OF MC12 TO FOUL.  GATX 72381, RESIDUE HAZMAT CAR, STRUCK SSW 80790 AND CSXT 126178 AS THEY ROLLED BY ON THE LEAD.  THERE WERENO LEAKS OR PUNCTURES.  GATX 72381 WAS DERAILED AND DAMAGED BUT NOT DERAILED IN THE INCIDENT WERE CSXT126178, SSW 80790 AND TTGX 983390.. INVESTIGATION FOUND THAT THE CONDUCTOR  ON JOB M 39731-28 FAILED TO PROTECT THE SHOVE MOVE AND THAT THE ENGINEER SHOVED THE JOB WITHOUT PROPER CARS COUNTS WHICH TO THE IMPACT.  CREW WAS TESTED AND ALL RESULTS WERE NEGATIVE.

NO CARS WERE DERAILED IN THE IMPACT HOWEVER ALL SUSTAINED DAMAGE.STEPHAN CHEMICAL MAINTAINS THE TRACK AT THE PLANT AND REPORTS NO DAMAGE.

0706LA053-d-07-26-06-UP.Primary Accident Cause: Other signal failures (Provide detailed description in narrative)
0706LA053-d-07-26-06-UP.Accident Cause: Other signal failures (Provide detailed description in narrative)
0706LA053-d-07-26-06-UP.Narrative: IGSAT-24 APPROACHED WEST SIGNAL AT GLAMIS WITH CLEAR INDICATION THAT CHANGED TO STOP AND STOPPED.  DISPATCHER GAVE PERMISSION TO MOVE; MOVED 2900 FT AND PULLED HARD.  CREW SAW DUST AND WALKED BACK TODISCOVER DERAILED ARTICULATED CARS.  SO99 -  ON JULY 26, 2006 AT CONTROL POINT (CP) SP697, M.P. 697.04, ON THE YUMA SUBDIVISION NEAR GLAMIS, CA., THE EASTBOUND IGSAT 24 REPORTED THAT THE ABSOLUTE SIGNAL AT THE CP DROPPED RED IN THE FACE OF THE TRAIN.  AFTER STOPPING, WITH THE LOCOMOTIVES PAST THE SIGNAL AT THE CP, AUTHORITY TO PROCEED WAS RECEIVED FROM THE DISPATCHER.  AS THE TRAIN DEPARTED, THE POWER SWITCH MACHINE BECAME UNLOCKED AND THE SWITCH POINTS OPENED UNDER THE 23RD HEAD CAR, DERAILING6 CARS.  AN INVESTIGATION REVEALED THAT THERE WERE SIGNIFICANT TRANSIENT AC VOLTAGES PRESENT ON SEVERAL OF THE SIGNAL CIRCUITS AT THE CP CAUSING ARCING BETWEEN CIRCUITS AND FIRING LIGHTNING ARRESTERS.ONE CIRCUIT EFFECTED WAS THE SWITCH CONTROL CIRCUIT, WHICH APPARENTLY MOVED TO THE REVERSE POSITION.  IT ALSO APPEARS THAT THE WR RELAY BECAME FALSELY ENERGIZED WHEN AN ARC MOMENTARILY PROVIDED A CURRENT PATH BYPASSING THE DETECTOR AND ROUTE LOCKING CONTACTS IN THE CONTROL CIRCUIT FOR THE WR RELAY.  THIS WOULD HAVE CAUSED THE SWITCH MACHINE TO UNLOCK AND MOVE IN THE REVERSE DIRECTION.  SEVERAL POSSIBLE SOURCES FOR THE TRANSIENT AC VOLTAGES WERE REMOVED AND A LOSS OF SHUNT TIMER WAS INSTALLED FOR THE "OS" TRACK CIRCUITS.  ALL APPLICABLE TESTS WERE THEN PERFORMED.

528754-d-07-25-06-GTW.Narrative: R95061-24 WAS SHOVING 36 LOADED BI-LEVEL CARS NORTHWARD INTO YP05 TO CLEAR THE RUN-AROUND TRACK WHENTHE 3RD, 4TH, 5TH AND 6TH CARS FROM  THE POINT OF THE SHOVE MOVE DERAILED IN MID TRACK.  CAR TTGX 983680 HAD A WHEEL HIT IRREGULAR RAIL ALIGNMENT WITH LOOSE BAR BOLTS ALLOWING THE RAIL TO SHIFT AND WHEEL TO CLIMB AT LOOSE JOINT.  THE FOUR DERAILED CARS WERE: CN 710866, TTGX 983680, TTGX 985234, TTGX 254497.
